description: This course investigates the legal framework in which business enterprise is conducted, including personal rights and duties, contracts, sales, agency, negotiable personal rights and duties, negotiable instruments, bailments, personal property and corporate obligations, and equities. Prerequisite: Economics 121 or 122 or consent of instructor. Offered annually.
name: Legal Aspects of Bus
prerequisites: Prerequisite: Economics 121 or 122 or consent of instructor. Offered annually.
title: Legal Aspects of Business
